snippet: Jason Kidd, the Nets’ new coach, was placed on interim probation and agreed to speak to Long Island high school students about the dangers of drunken driving.
abstract: Jason Kidd pleads guilty to a drunken-driving charge, exposing him to a likely suspension from the NBA that could postpone his coaching debut with Brooklyn Nets; he is placed on interim probation and agrees to speak to Long Island high school students about the dangers of drunken driving as part of a plea deal.
lead_paragraph: Jason Kidd, the Nets’ new coach, was placed on interim probation and agreed to speak to Long Island high school students about the dangers of drunken driving.

headline.main: Kidd Settles a Court Case but Still Faces a Suspension
headline.print_headline: Kidd Settles a Court Case But Still Faces a Suspension
